resources.string: Allow livescore/score mirroring using MQTT publish/subscribe mechanism
Either a public or private broker can be used. By default, a public broker without authentication is configured
Topic placeholder when publishing the complete match status in json
Topic placeholder when publishing devices joining/leaving the mqtt broker
Topic placeholder when publishing changes in a match
Topic placeholder when subscribing to changes in a match on another device
Unique device id of the device you want to mirror the score for
This ID is used to uniquely identify this device. It should be entered on another device as \'Other device id\' to achieve mirroring the score using MQTT
To more easily identify different devices used in the same venue
Turned off MQTT after to many failed reconnect attempts
Number of seconds before reading a feed is automatically cancelled
Hide logo when game in progress
Hide division field when game in progress
Preferred behaviour of visual elements. Official announcements.
Higher values for more pause between words (0–2500)
Play a hardly audible audio file from time to time to prevent long silence. If not used for audio over BlueTooth, after a long silence, words may appear to be swallowed
Number of seconds of silence before shortly playing white noise. Ideal duration might depend on Bluetooth device used
Increase only for testing purposes. The white noise sound file is supposed to be played as inaudible as possible
Control the colors of the Squore Board elements
Small player image specified in feed
Control the text size of the Squore Board elements
Choose a set of colors (that can be chosen from to set background- and text-colors)
Depending on the background color or manually
Color the text instead of the button
Determine on which GUI elements de chosen player color is shown
What initial colors to use for the 2 players/teams
High values (max 100) make the button of the receiver less visible
Text on Score Buttons as big as possible
On some devices going to double digits makes digits disappear if this option is used.
Without the actionbar more room is available to use larger font size for the score (requires restart)
Show text in action bar buttons
How to show game scores on scoreboard
Choose between \'short\' like 1-0, 2-0, 2-1 vs \'full games scores\' like 11-8, 11-7, 5-11
Size of icon in \'Appeal\' dialog. Set to zero if you do not want to see the icons.
To have just a limited number of fields to fill, choose \'Simple\'
Show short message with the official announcement of the decision (after Appeal or Misconduct)
\'Volume Up\' scores a point for player A, \'Volume Down\' for B
Do you want to use the volume buttons for entering the score with device in portrait orientation?\n(Option can be turned off again in \'Settings/Behaviour\')
The action that will be performed automatically when the app is started
How to reflect/trigger change of sides on scoreboard
Swap players when device is rotated 180 degrees
Allows to swap players on screen by rotating the device, or showing score to players by flipping device forward towards players
Swap players at the start of a new game
Swap players after every odd game
When a game ends automatically open the screen to show graphical representation
To maintain Winner/Error statistics per player
BH/FH, Front/Volley/Back, Ball Direction, Ball Trajectory
Either \'Suggest\' to show floating button, \'Automatic\' to show directly at start of match, or \'Do not use\'
Either \'Suggest\' to show floating button, \'Automatic\' to share directly at end of match, or \'Do not use\'
Share action to execute at the end of a match when \'Share\' feature is set to \'Suggest\' or \'Automatic\'
Official announcements: Either \'Suggest\' to show floating button, \'Automatic\' to show directly when applicable, or \'Do not use\'
Either \'Suggest\' to show floating button, \'Automatic\' to show directly when applicable, or \'Do not use\'
Either \'Suggest\' to show dialog, \'Automatic\' to end game directly when applicable, or \'Do not use\'
Lock match to prevent accidental changes
When to lock match to prevent accidental changes
Language in which \'Announcements\' should be suggested
Number of blinks for feedback per point
The number of times the score button blinks when the score changed
Blink the changed score a few seconds after each score change. Specifically handy if score is controlled remotely.
Vibrate shortly each time a point is added, game is ended or undo action is performed
Vibrate shortly if a game ending score has been reached
If the match is unchanged for this number of minutes it is automatically locked
Give visual feedback in score buttons about the fact that the next rally may lead to winning a game
Show a \'floating message\' when it is game- or match ball
Allow scoring via media playback control buttons
e.g. use \'Previous song\' for scoring for player A, and \'Next song\' for scoring for B, and \'Play/Pause\' for Undo
Show convenient floating button to start a new match (when appropriate)
Prevent screen from going to sleep during referee-ing a match
Show automatically. Duration. Play sound and/or vibrate when done.
Manage what values are used for AutoComplete when you are entering player names with the keyboard.
Number of games to play, to how many points, scoring mechanism
Show info of last games in timer dialog
First one of the URLs is used from \'Show/Official squash rules\' menu option
First one of the URLs is used to retrieve flags if countries are specified.
Usage of: toss, timer, announcements, end of game
Adjust options: side button within score button, fullscreen, actionbar to maximize screen usage
Play notification sound when timer ends (and when 15 seconds are left of pause, and at half-time of warm-up)
Show button to pause the timer
Hide timer when time is up
Show tiny chronometer showing how long \'Time!\' is showing
Grouping and sorting of archived matches
Let device vibrate when timer ends (and when 15 seconds are left of pause, and at half-time of warm-up)
The number of seconds players get for a warm-up on court. Officially 4 minutes: 2 minutes per side
The number of seconds between games
The number of seconds before the next game must start. Officially 90 seconds. (PSA: 120)
Selectable values for time between games
Selectable values at the start of a new match for the number of seconds between games for that match (typically 90 or 120)
Selectable values for warmup at the start of a new match
The number of seconds to recover from an injury
The number of seconds a player has to recover and resume play after an injury. Officially 180 seconds.
What orientations to use. Portrait is less intuitive but easier single-handed.
Allowing for e.g. all scores (games/sets) to visible with similar digit size. Less easy to change score. Typically useful when controlling score via remote device.
Save matches for re-consulting the results later.
Number of points to win the game. Officially this is 11.
Number of games to win match. Officially this is 3.
To start a score other than 0–0
Player can indicate next rally as \'Power Play\' for him/her and that player gets two points if he wins that rally
Number of Power Plays each player may use per match
\'Old\' scoring format. Player can only score if he served.
What rule to follow in case of a tie-break
Allow Scoring With Wearable Hardware Buttons
Feed URLs for match selection. Post match result to website. Share match result.
For autocomplete when typing in player names
For autocomplete when typing in players club name
The number of characters you need to type before autocomplete kicks in to suggest possible player names
Number of characters for autocomplete country
The number of characters you need to type before autocomplete kicks in to suggest possible country names
Number of players in a group/team
Maximum number of players in a group. E.g. to add all 6 matches for a group of 4 players into \'My list\'
When a match selected from the list is finished, the app may suggest to remove it from \'My list\'
If a recent result exists for a match selected from \'My List\', use that result as a starting point
Fixed list of matches for easy selection

If you need to ref multiple matches, you can define them here up front for easy selection later on. You can also control this list by entering (copy/pasting) plain text in the \'%1$s\' section of the \'%2$s\' screen.
Configure URLs here that serve as Feed (and optionally Post) urls. Format is Name=displayname,FeedMatches=http://input,PostResult=http://post (serves as possible values for \'Active URLs\')
Actual URLs used when \'Select new match\' is chosen (and if a post URL for \'Post result\')
Posting JSON provides more details but the exact data may change with new versions of the app.
Use Feed Name as Event Name
Use the name of the Feed from which you select a match as Event Name for that match
Use Group Name as Event Data
Use the name of the group from which you select a match as Event Name and Round for that match

You can control what matches appear here by switching Feed by pressing the \'Globe\' button. You can also add your own Feed by providing one or more URLs in the \'%1$s\' section of the \'%2$s\' screen. Consult the help pages for more info.

You can specify to what site the match result is posted. In cooperation with e.g. your squash clubs webmaster, match results can be made available online directly. Consult the help pages for more info.
Read names of contacts and use them for \'Auto Complete\' functionality when entering player names.
Maximum number of contacts to read for autocompletion
Increase at your own risk if you actually do have more contacts than this number

If your device holds a lot of contacts this may cause Squore to become slow 
 - At startup 
 - When manually typing in player names. 
 
This device contains %1$d contacts
Read only names of my contacts that are in this \'Contact Group\'
Suggest to post match result when a match has ended. If unchecked you can still post a match result via \'Post match result to site\'
The tournament ended maximum x days ago
The tournament will start in x days or less
The tournament will last x days at most
A feed may contain already played matches (by including the result). If you don\'t want to see these matches, check this option
A feed may specify on which court a match is (supposed to be) played. If so, and this option is active, matches will be grouped per court
Remove e.g. the [5/8] seeding string after selecting a match from a feed
Switch to player list if match list of feed is empty
Default phone number for \'SMS Result\' action
The phone number that will be pre-filled when you choose menu option \'Share/Message Match Result\'
Referee name as it will appear in the \'Score sheet\' if you share it
For autocomplete when typing in referee/marker names
Default email address for \'Mail Result\' action
The email address that will be pre-filled when you choose menu option \'Mail Result\'
The composed email will include a complete scoring sheet
You can set a default mail recipient in the \'%1$s\' screen of \'%2$s\'
Allow negative values when entering handicap score
Optimize for, and view Live Score
Use this URL to have see all matches shared with this app, e.g. related to your event
This ID can be used to get only matches from this device on the Live Score webpage
Ensure Firebase Cloud messages can be used and interpreted to e.g. change the score
Show toast for received FCM message
Show a toast message for every received FCM message
Allow changing the score on the device by accessing certain URLs. Once enabled use Menu > Show > FCM - Info
This ID is used to uniquely identify this device. It will be part of the FCM URL (URL that can be used to change the score on this device)
Adjust options: Use Share Feature (to Automatic) and Action For Share (to Match Details After Each Point) to optimize live score support
Show Chrome Cast button in action bar
Show game scores and score graph of last game between games and at end of match
URL of logo for Cast Screen
Load specified logo image URL on Cast Screen
URL of sponsor for Cast Screen
Load specified sponsor image URL on Cast Screen
No need to change manually. Mainly for testing
Allow controlling the score by connected Bluetooth LE devices like D-Score wristbands
Show small messages about buttons being pressed/to be pressed at bottom of the screen

Number of seconds before a signal is sent to the ble device of the player/team to confirm score (making the device vibrate shortly). Only when scoring with one BLE devices per player/team with \'Score confirmation\'
Ignore accidental double press click threshold
If a second BLE device click is received from the same button within this number of milliseconds, the second signal will be ignored
Unique name or MAC address of Peripheral
Services and Characteristics of device, button logic
For this to take effect a restart is required
Revert all values to their defaults?
Down: number of serves left. Up: consecutive serves to be performed
